snippet: Detroit’s collapse is indicative of a broader nationwide problem: United States manufacturing has been in trouble since its heyday in the 1950s.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Globalist publisher Stephan Richter contends Detroit's collapse is indicative of a more profound nationwide problem; maintains United States manufacturing has been in trouble since its heyday in the 1950s; notes much of America's post-World War II economic dominance was due to a momentary quirk in history: absence of any real competition from other nations.
lead_paragraph: Detroit’s collapse is indicative of a broader nationwide problem: United States manufacturing has been in trouble since its heyday in the 1950s.
